metadata.Title: CVE-2014-5270 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.Description:
Libgcrypt before 1.5.4, as used in GnuPG and other products, does notproperly perform ciphertext normalization and ciphertext randomization,which makes it easier for physically proximate attackers to conductkey-extraction attacks by leveraging the ability to collect voltage datafrom exposed metal, a different vector than CVE-2013-4576.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-5270` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libgcrypt20 - 1.6.1-2ubuntu1
No subscription required

libgcrypt11 - 1.5.3-2ubuntu4.1
No subscription required

gnupg - 1.4.16-1ubuntu2.1
gnupg-curl - 1.4.16-1ubuntu2.1
gpgv - 1.4.16-1ubuntu2.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: libgcrypt20 package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.6.1-2ubuntu1').
libgcrypt11 package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.5.3-2ubuntu4.1').
gnupg package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.4.16-1ubuntu2.1').
